1523460.name: Dstroy 2
1523460.description:
Dstroy 2 is a solo or couch co-op 2d Pixelart puzzle-action adventure, and an orthogonal maze top-down Battle-royal competitive game inspired by the famous Bomberman game series.
It's a sequel of Dstroy, our first game release in 1995 on Ms-dos.

The final game will propose three Main modes:

  • Adventure (solo or co-op).
    Adventure mode is actually not available in the demo. It will be possible to play it Solo or Coop with friends, like the first Dstroy.

  • Tournaments (Vs 2 to 4 players).
    Local tournaments (player VS players) propose 3 different modes (Classic, Roots and Paint) with their own Gameplay. All are fully available in the demo and bring short intense and fun games sessions. Bots/AI are available for you to play and train when solo or when missing opponents to complete the roster.

  • Survival (solo or coop).
    It's a solo or co-op challenging Score ladder mode in a slowly sinking lava world that will start to catch up if you're too slow. With only one life even in coop, it's a difficult but rewarding mode to challenge your skills. Each game will offer a slightly random layout to spice it a little.

The 3 Tournaments modes are:

  • Classic. (Vs).
    Battle royal mode with multiple random bonuses and malus to spice up. The last one alive gets the victory point, 3 victories and you're the winner of this game, 1 or up to 4 players. AI Bots available.  

  • Roots. (Vs).
    No randomness here, just skills! Basic main bonuses on smaller "square" battle arena maps like the good old days.

  • Paint (Vs).
    You have one minute to paint the maximum amount of ground area with your color to win the game. Kick the bombs to create Mega splash of paint or pick up random rare extra mushrooms with different effects that might help you, or not, on your path to victory.

For now, we're aiming in the final version to offer the tournament and survival modes for free, so the maximum number of players can enjoy the game. The Adventure pack would be "premium" and unlocked when bought. The adventure "pack" should offer Steam Achievements and Steam cards.

The game will be fully Steam Remote Play compatible.  No Online mode is scheduled for now.

Enjoy the demo, and if you like it, please consider to wishlist us, or to contact us if any question!
